result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad Lee Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chad Lee Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chad Lee Anderson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B", Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Chad Lee Anderson was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A", Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
